summary: Add FAQ and PII Disclaimer to IaC for streamlined updates
description:
As an infra engineer I need to add the FAQ and PII disclaimer, Values to the IaC, so they can be updated without having to build a new image

A/C: Values for FAQ and PII are added to the IaC for the mlops API and loaded into a configmap

summary: part 1- investigate legacy issue to fix LCC pipeline
description:
As a MLE or tenant it is important to maintain all domains in service and this ticket is to investigate the incorrect attachment of legacy LCCs and how to prevent failed domain updates in the future to prevent disruptions in service

AC:
Determine if it is possible to add a check step to the LCC attachment in Jenkins to make sure all LCC's being attached are appropriate and exist
Identify what other steps or updates in addition to the LCC attachment script can have error checking on making sure all updates will succeed

summary: Track  new EntraID Groups for infra team - RBAC Saga
description:
**As an BIP-AI member, I need a new EntraID Group created for the RBAC Saga to properly manage access control and permissions for BIP infrastructure components.**

**A/C:**
 * Track a new EntraID Group from VA, which will form the basis for cluster permissions for the infra team. Follow the established naming convention and be integrated with the existing RBAC framework for BIP infrastructure.
- When the EntraID Group are provisioned, more work will be done to integrate teh EntraID group in following stories.

summary: Modularize objects from All Resources view to split up all functionality to be used elsewhere
description:
**Story:**
As a frontend developer working on the BIP AI platform, I need to modularize the All Resources view Vue.js components by extracting reusable functionality into separate components to improve code maintainability, enable component reuse across the application, and reduce the complexity of the main view.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Extract the main data table component into a separate reusable Vue file
- Modularize the pause functionality component for standalone use
- Extract the deep pause feature into its own component
- Create a separate component for the hard refresh functionality
- Modularize all modal components used in the All Resources view
- Extract any other reusable UI elements or utility functions into separate components
- Ensure all extracted components maintain their current functionality and behavior
- Update the All Resources view to import and use the new modular components
- Implement proper props and events communication between parent and child components
- Add appropriate component documentation and prop validation
- Maintain all existing CSS styling and responsive behavior

**Definition of Done:**
- All Resources view file length significantly reduced while maintaining full functionality
- Each extractable feature exists as an independent Vue component in separate files
- All modular components properly tested and validated in SBX environment
- No functionality lost during the modularization process
- Component props and events properly defined with TypeScript interfaces where applicable
- All new components follow Vue.js and project coding standards
- Pull request created with clear description of modularization changes
- Code review completed by team members with approval
- Pull request successfully merged to main branch
- SBX testing confirms all features work as expected post-modularization

summary: Update TERA notifications to prevent silent failures in jobs
description:
Value Statement
As a BIP AI Tenant on the TERA team who relies on job notifications, I need the ability to receive comprehensive alerts for job failures so that issues are detected and addressed promptly.

Acceptance Criteria

When a TERA job (e.g., backup or main job) fails or does not write output, an alert is sent via Grafana or Jenkins to Slack.
Manual validation: Confirm all relevant failures trigger notifications and no silent failures occur.

summary: Update existing or create new namespace w data from annotations table to view annotations table data in Grafana
description:
Value Statement
As a BIP AI Tenant on the gen Ann team who monitors data, I need the ability to view annotations table data in Grafana so that I can track and analyze relevant metrics.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user accesses the Grafana dashboard, data from the annotations table is available via the updated or newly created namespace.
Manual validation: Confirm annotations data appears correctly in the Grafana dashboard.

summary: Redesign/restructure SPA repo to streamline code base and reduce tech debt
description:
Value Statement:

As a SE who maintains SPA, I need the ability to reorganize the repository and retire legacy assets after the Lambda + API Gateway work is complete so that the codebase remains clean, maintainable, and easier to onboard and deploy.

Acceptance Criteria:

- When the Lambda + API Gateway migration is completed and stable, the user has the ability to work in a reorganized SPA repository with legacy assets removed or archived without breaking builds or deployments.

- GitHub Actions/Jenkins workflows are updated; stale workflows are removed or moved to archive; required secrets/parameters remain intact.

Dependencies:

Ticket Lambda + API Gateway--Seth H.

Finalize AWS Documentation MCP so that it can be reliably queried and demonstrated
description:
As an MLE building MCP deployments, I want to finalize the AWS Documentation MCP server setup and supporting resources s that it can be reliably queried and demonstrated as a reference implementation for future MCP work.

AC: Sagemaker notebook expanded beyond tool-listing to demonstrate at least one successful query/response against AWS docs. Notebook instructions include clear usage steps (connect, query, interpret response)

summary: Create an automated way to define the OpenAPI schema, so bedrock agent creation can be accelerated
description:
As an MLE who is creating Bedrock agents using MCPs, I want to create an automate way to define the OpenAPI schema, so bedrock agent creation can be accelerated.

AC: Function created in notebook that can automatically infer the schema from an mcp and upload it to a lambda function action group.

summary: Integrate Playwright MCP Starter Repo With Test Automation Team for VBMS
description:
Value Statement

As a developer who will leverage Playwright MCP, I would like to work with the Test Automation team to integrate VBMS based tests using the new Playwright MCP starter repo created by BIP AI.

Acceptance Criteria

Successfully work with test automation team to integrate VBMS testing using the new Playwright MCP starter repo.

summary: Create Figma MCP Demo so that users can see workflow
description:
As an MLE enabling frontend engineers to adopt Figma MCP, I want to deliver a clear and polished demo video that walks through setup, usage, and results so that viewers can quickly understand how to integrate and benefit from the MCP workflow.

AC: Final video is exported in a shareable format and stored in the MFE Archetype repo.

AC:

summary: Unify LCCs for all environments to simplify development startup
description:
Value Statement
As a MLOps engineer who maintains development environments for SageMaker,  I need to fix the LCCs so that there is one unified script that only uses S3` script 

Acceptance Criteria

When a Tenant uses SageMaker and  utilizes the LCC to start up their environment, it should be simple and default. 
It will also setup the LCC to only use a script stored in S3 (editable) to not make any new versions of the LCC.

summary: Build Bedrock Prompt Library so that the agents reasoning logic is centralized, version-controlled, and easily auditable
description:
Value Statement:  As a BIP AI MLOps engineer who manages prompts in Bedrock I need the ability to create and manage Bedrock prompt templates for prompts used internally by the MLOps team so they are  centralized, version-controlled, and easily auditable

Acceptance Criteria:
The Bedrock prompt management includes prompts used by the by the MLOps team. The prompts templates have been tested and produce the expected output.

Assumptions:
IAM permissions for Bedrock Prompt Management are available in the target AWS environment.

summary: run mlkit release for reduced dependency
description:
Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who maintains shared tools, I need to create a new mlkit release in the repo, verify Jenkins pipelines execute successfully in each environment, and update the lifecycle configuration so that tenants can reliably use the latest version.

Acceptance Criteria

A new mlkit release is created in the repo.
Jenkins pipelines execute successfully in each environment and publish the new version.
The new mlkit version is available in all supported environments.
The lifecycle configuration (LCC) is updated to reference the new version.

summary: enable sagemaker pipelines scheduler so that it can be used to schedule pipelines for tenants
description:
Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who wants to use the new Sagemaker feature, I need the ability to enable SageMaker Scheuler so that it can be used to schedule pipelines for tenants.

Acceptance Criteria
When a SM pipeline is created, the scheduler feature should be able to be used through the SageMaker UI and through the notebook. Verify that the pipeline ran and test that it is able to be scheduled at specific times without failing.

summary: Design bedrock events in sagemaker monitor o that BIP AI UI can display bedrock events as well as sagemaker events for tenants
description:
Value Statement
As a BIP AI infra security engineer who monitors bedrock resource events, I need the ability to design the integration of bedrock events with sagemaker events so that BIP AI UI can display bedrock events as well as sagemaker events for tenants.

Acceptance Criteria

1 Research various bedrock event logs, e.g. model invocation, inference profile invocation, agent activity, knowledgebase access etc.
2. Investigate bedrock cloudtrail logs.
3. Research sagemaker monitor to design integration pattern to integrate bedrock logs.

summary: Harness PR Template with Copilot prompt so that pull requests follow a consistent structure
description:
As a BIP AI team member who contributes to pipeline development, I need a standardized Harness PR template with a GitHub Copilot prompt so that pull requests follow a consistent structure and developers can auto-generate key sections of the PR for faster, clearer submissions.

When the template is used, it includes fields for description, acceptance criteria, testing evidence, and related tickets.
When reviewers view PRs, they see consistent formatting across all Harness-related submissions.
When developers use GitHub Copilot, a pre-defined prompt guides them to auto-fill the PR template with meaningful content (e.g., pipeline name, changes made, testing performed).

summary: Mirgate Jenkins Secrets to Harness Mgmt so that pipelines running in Harness can securely access credentials without relying on Jenkins.
description:
As a BIP AI  team member who manages CI/CD credentials, I need to migrate existing Jenkins secrets into Harness Secrets Manager so that pipelines running in Harness can securely access credentials without relying on Jenkins.

When migration is complete, all identified Jenkins secrets are stored in Harness Secrets Manager with proper naming and scope.
When pipelines run in Harness, they successfully consume the migrated secrets without authentication failures.
When Jenkins is decommissioned, no Harness pipelines remain dependent on Jenkins secrets.

summary: Build prototype Bedrock KB custom provider So that Crossplane can be accessed
description:
As an BIP-AI member, I need a new prototype a custom Crossplane Provider for Bedrock Knowledge Bases. There are no readily available solutions that works for us, therefore the need to build it ourselves.
 * Ensure prototype works with the Crossplane runtime.
 *  Ensure provider communicates with AWS SDK with to CRUD for Bedrock Knowledge Bases. 
 * Ensure provider works with our current infrastructure setup.

summary: Create Image Builder Pipeline in Harness so that container images can be built and maintained - Mgmt - dev
description:
As a BIP AI team member who manages CI/CD pipelines, I need to create a new image builder pipeline in the Harness mgmt instance, based on the existing repo definition from Harness sbx, so that container images can be built and maintained centrally with the correct configuration.

When the pipeline is created in Harness mgmt, it uses the existing repo definition as a reference.
When implemented, the new pipeline contains the necessary modifications for compatibility with the mgmt environment.
When triggered, the new pipeline successfully builds and pushes container images without errors.
When configured, the pipeline uses mgmt secrets, connectors, and service accounts.

summary: Create new SCC knowledge base with new chunking strategy
description:
Value Statement:

As a BIP-AI MLOps engineer who maintains infrastructure for knowledge base creation, I need the ability to ensure that OpenSearch indices are created with the correct embedding size so that knowledge base creation does not fail due to mismatched model configurations.

Acceptance Criteria:
- When a user initiates knowledge base creation, the system creates the OpenSearch index with the embedding size aligned to the currently configured Titan model.
- The mismatch between embedding size and model configuration is resolved to prevent index creation failure.

summary: Create cross-platform developer environment setup to reduce onboarding time and environment inconsistencies
description:
Value Statement:

As a developer on the bip-ai infrastructure team, I want an automated setup for a local development environment so that I can quickly bootstrap all required infrastructure tools and focus on development rather than environment configuration.


Acceptance Criteria:

Given a developer on MacOS, Windows, or Linux when they run the justfile install command then Minikube, ArgoCD, Crossplane, LocalStack, aws-adfs, and all supporting CLI tools are installed successfully
Given a developer on a GFE machine when they run the setup then the system automatically configures VA certificates for image pulling from Minikube
Given a developer on a BAH Mac when they run the setup then the system automatically configures Zscaler certificates for image pulling from Minikube
Given the justfile when executed then it pulls Crossplane provider image versions based on BIP's current provider list
Given a configured environment when a developer runs the start command then Minikube starts successfully with proper certificate configuration and memory (10000 minimum)
Given a running environment when a developer runs the stop command then Minikube stops gracefully without data loss
Given the setup process when dependencies need updating then a separate variable file can be modified without changing the justfile directly
Given the installation on BAH Mac and GFE Windows Linux VM when tested then all functionality works correctly on both platforms


Definition of Done:

All acceptance criteria met
Tests completed on BAH Mac and GFE Windows Linux VM
Documentation updated with setup and usage instructions
Variable file created for dependency management
Justfile created in bip-ai-developer repository with install, start, and stop commands
Cross-platform compatibility verified for MacOS, Windows, and Linux


Dependencies:

Access to bip-ai-developer repository
Test access to both BAH Mac and GFE Windows environments (Virtual Machine/VBox)
Machine must have Docker Desktop or runtime previously installed
Machine requires access to BIP DEV ECR repo / ePAS to pull Crossplane images

summary: PI planning prep
